name: Malcolm Holmes

topics.response_text: Oh, that's right! Here, let me show you what I've got on hand.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to know more about star hunting.
topics.response_text: There's not much more to tell. Get enough stars and the treasure's yours. Just watch out for some of the other people collecting them.

topics.topic_text: No, I have to be going.
topics.response_text: If you say so. Maybe we'll meet again.
It started off innocently enough. I was traveling, as I often do, and happened to observe you picking up one of those blue-star caps.

topics.topic_text: Don't follow me. You'll live longer.
topics.response_text: Okay, you're a dangerous sort. I get that. But I have some information I think you'll find useful, which made me follow you for a spell.

topics.topic_text: What's so special about these caps?
topics.response_text: There's an old wasteland legend that says somewhere out there is a fabulous treasure from before the war.

topics.topic_text: Why didn't you say anything then and there?
topics.response_text: I had to make sure of your disposition. There's a lot of jumpy folks out there that'd shoot a man as soon as talk to him.

topics.topic_text: This is getting creepy. I'm leaving, and don't follow me.
topics.response_text: Fine. Just do me a favor. If you find more of those things, and plan on keeping them, watch out for a man named Allen Marks.

topics.topic_text: Where can I find more of these caps?
topics.response_text: All over the place. The easiest place to find them is unopened bottles of Sunset Sarsaparilla.

topics.topic_text: So you collect these caps too?
topics.response_text: Nah, I gave it up years ago. Too dangerous. And even if I did still collect them, I'd tell you the same.

topics.topic_text: What kind of treasure are we talking about?
topics.response_text: No one knows. Money? Weapons? Water? It is, or maybe was, something of value, and that's enough to get people motivated.

topics.topic_text: You mentioned someone named Festus. Who's that?
topics.response_text: It's said that the treasure is guarded by a man named Festus, and he's the one who asks for the blue-star caps.

conversation.topic_text: Thanks for the info, but I'll be going now.
conversation.response_text: No problem. If you do end up trying to collect more stars, watch out for a man named Allen Marks. He's killed several people for their stars already.

description:
Malcolm Holmes is a 58 year-old African American Male.

Malcolm Holmes is a retired trader living in the Mojave Wasteland in 2281. He's an elderly African American man with weathered skin and eyes that have seen too many dangers in the wasteland. Though he claims to have retired from collecting Sunset Sarsaparilla star bottle caps, he still carries a few with him as souvenirs of his adventurous past.

Malcolm Holmes's Personality: Cautious yet nostalgic, Malcolm is a man who values his privacy but can't help reminiscing about his days as a collector. He's secretive about his past adventures but willing to share stories with those who show genuine interest. He carries a quiet wisdom that comes from decades of surviving in the harsh Mojave environment.

Malcolm Holmes's Backstory: Malcolm Holmes was once a prominent trader in the Mojave Wasteland, specializing in rare pre-War artifacts and memorabilia. For years, he was obsessed with collecting Sunset Sarsaparilla star bottlecaps, believing that accumulating enough of them would unlock a hidden treasure in the company's headquarters. After decades of searching and trading, Malcolm finally amassed enough caps to claim his reward. However, the experience left him paranoid and cautious, as he witnessed firsthand the lengths people would go to obtain the valuable star caps. He decided to retire from the collecting business and now lives a quiet life, though he still carries a few caps with him as mementos of his past adventures.
